title: Mercedes Won't Turn To Its Stark Rival For an Upcoming Engine
description: In August, reports circulated that Mercedes-Benz and BMW were preparing a rare collaboration. Mercedes was allegedly in advanced talks to source BMW's B48 2.0-liter turbocharged four-cylinder engine. The arrangement was said to target upcoming plug-in hybrid versions of smaller Mercedes models, ...
titleSummary: Mercedes Rules Out Engine Partnership with Arch-Rival Amid High-Stakes Development
descriptionSummary: Rumors emerged in August of an unlikely partnership between Mercedes-Benz and BMW, with the two automakers reportedly on the cusp of a deal that would see Mercedes adopt BMW's efficient 2.0-liter turbo engine for future eco-friendly model upgrades.

title: Someone Took A Toyota Supra Final Edition On Its Final Ride Already
description: Speaking from personal experience, the B58 engine in the Toyota Supra is a bit of a handful. Power comes on pretty hard once the turbos get involved, and it's real easy to run out of grip, talent, or both. We're not sure what happened to the owner of this particular model, but it didn't take long ...
titleSummary: "Supra's Swan Song: Thrill-Seeker Takes Final Edition on a Fateful Joyride"
descriptionSummary: The Toyota Supra's B58 engine packs a potent punch, but its sudden surge in power can be tricky to manage on tight roads. One owner learned that lesson the hard way.

title: Best and Worst Used EVs for Battery Health per 10,000 Miles
description: Used EV shoppers care about used EV battery degradation more than paint colors and wheel sizes. Fresh 2025 SOH data from telematics, on-board diagnostics (OBD) uploads, fleet health reports, and auction disclosures says the story is steady: modern packs age slowly, and the best models lose very ...
titleSummary: Electric Vehicles' Hidden Downside: Top Performers and Disappointments After 10,000 Mile Mark
descriptionSummary: As electric vehicle shoppers prioritize durability over aesthetics, new data reveals a reassuring trend: modern EV batteries age remarkably slowly, with top performers retaining nearly full capacity well into their lifespan.

title: Beyond Maybach: Larte’s Carbon-Fiber Body Kit Adds Extra Exclusivity to the GLS
description: Europe is littered with aftermarket companies producing loud body kits for luxury SUVs, so what sets the Larte Design Charisma body kit for the Mercedes-Maybach GLS apart is its restraint. Compared to the likes of Mansory, or even some of Larte's previous work, the changes are relatively tasteful. ...
titleSummary: "Larte Takes Luxury to New Heights with Exclusive Carbon Fiber Upgrade for the GLS"
descriptionSummary: Among a sea of ostentatious upgrades for luxury SUVs, Larte Design's Charisma body kit stands out for its understated approach. The modifications are subtle and sophisticated, elevating the Mercedes-Maybach GLS with refined flair.

title: Lotus Elise Reborn as Central-Seat Supercar Slayer That Weighs Less Than a Miata
description: The automotive world has spent thirty years trying to improve on the original 1996 Lotus Elise formula, adding power steering, air conditioning, and creature comforts that missed the point entirely. The Series 1 Elise weighed under 1,600 lbs and proved that lightweight engineering could deliver ...
titleSummary: "New Lotus Elise Emerges with Rear Seat, Lightweight Power to Take on Mazda MX-5"
descriptionSummary: For three decades, automakers have attempted to refine the 1996 Lotus Elise's groundbreaking design, gradually adding features that compromised its original intent. Yet, its simplicity remained a secret to exceptional performance.

title: Next Toyota Corolla Spotted With Bold Yet Familiar Styling
description: Few nameplates carry the weight of the Toyota Corolla. Since its debut in the 1960s, it has grown into one of the world’s best-selling cars and a cornerstone of Toyota’s lineup. The current 12th generation has been on sale since 2018, and while it has received minor updates – including a light ...
titleSummary: "Corolla Takes the Road Less Ordinary with Sleek, Sophisticated New Look"
descriptionSummary: The Toyota Corolla is an automotive icon with a legacy spanning over five decades. First introduced in the 1960s, this beloved model has become one of the world's most popular cars and a stalwart of Toyota's lineup since its debut.

title: Lamborghini Wants AI to Fix Your Bad Driving Habits
description: We’ve all been worried about AI taking our jobs or robots taking over the country, but Lamborghini’s new idea may take tech in a more irritating direction. The automaker recently spoke with The Drive, telling the publication that it’s working on AI-driven tech that could help compensate for ...
titleSummary: "Lamborghini Aims to Rein in Reckless Drivers with Revolutionary AI Technology"
descriptionSummary: Lamborghini's latest innovation has sparked concern about the potential consequences of advanced technology. The luxury carmaker is developing AI-powered systems to augment human abilities, but some may find its implications more annoying than alarming.

title: Engine Teardown: Inside a Dead Porsche Macan S V6 Engine
description: Porsche's 3.0-liter twin-turbo V6 gives the first-generation Macan, especially in its S guise, the punch of a proper sports car wrapped in an SUV body. With 340 horsepower and a fat torque band, it hustles off the line and cruises effortlessly on the highway. Paired with a quick-shifting ...
titleSummary: "Porsche's High-Tech Heartbeat: What Happens When a Macan's V6 Dies"
descriptionSummary: The first-generation Macan's potent 3.0-liter twin-turbo V6 engine unleashes 340 horsepower, propelling this SUV-turned-sports-car to rapid acceleration and seamless cruising, all while its robust torque provides instant response to driver input.

title: Volkswagen’s $1.2B AI Bet: 3 Ways It Plans to Cut Costs by 2030
description: Volkswagen has announced plans to invest up to one billion euros by 2030 in AI-driven vehicle development, high-performance IT infrastructure, and industrial applications. In other words, Volkswagen is using AI to expedite the development stages of new vehicle models and technologies, while also ...
titleSummary: Volkswagen's Ambitious AI Strategy Aims for Big Savings by 2030 Deadline
descriptionSummary: Volkswagen is embarking on a ambitious technological overhaul, committing up to one billion euros by 2030 to harness the power of artificial intelligence across its vehicle development, IT infrastructure, and industrial processes.

title: Mystery Surrounds Piece of GM Design History Found in NY Barn
description: Daydreaming about finding a valuable classic car forgotten in a barn has almost become a hobby for some enthusiasts, but few likely dream of what one New York collector found. In 2024, Josh Quick found a binder of decades-old General Motors design drawings that show the automaker’s big plans from ...
titleSummary: "Rare Car Treasure Discovered in New York Barn Shrouded in Automotive Enigma"
descriptionSummary: For some car enthusiasts, scouring dusty barns for hidden gems has become a thrilling pastime. But one lucky collector in New York stumbled upon something extraordinary: a treasure trove of vintage General Motors designs, dated to 2024.

title: Toyota’s Next Big EV Might Be a Land Cruiser Made in America
description: Toyota gave enthusiasts a glimpse of an electric future when it unveiled the Land Cruiser Se Concept at the 2023 Japan Mobility Show. The sleek, battery-powered SUV hinted that Toyota was willing to electrify one of its most storied nameplates, but the company stopped short of promising production. ...
titleSummary: "Made-in-America Electric Toyota Land Cruiser Emerges as Company's Latest Game-Changer"
descriptionSummary: At the 2023 Japan Mobility Show, Toyota previewed a pioneering electric vehicle by unveiling the Land Cruiser Se Concept, an all-electric take on the iconic SUV that suggests a bold new direction for the legendary brand.

title: AMG Fans Win: Mercedes May Ditch Disappointing 4-Cylinder for Inline-Six in Next C 63
description: The Mercedes-AMG C 63 S E Performance is an engineering tour de force, boasting a plug-in hybrid powertrain generating 671 horsepower and 752 pound-feet of torque. But the internal-combustion part of that powertrain—a turbocharged 2.0-liter inline-four—has disappointed fans used to the old C 63's ...
titleSummary: "C-63 Revival: Mercedes Considering a Six-Powered Return to Form"
descriptionSummary: The Mercedes-AMG C 63 S E Performance showcases remarkable engineering, pairing a potent plug-in hybrid system with a high-revving 2.0L four-cylinder engine producing 671 horsepower and 752 lb-ft of torque. However, its smaller displacement has left some enthusiasts underwhelmed.

title: Very Special 2009 Bentley Azure for Sale With Just 1,800 Miles
description: Finding a barely used luxury car is rare enough, but discovering a 2009 Bentley Azure with only 1,800 miles on the odometer is like stumbling upon treasure. descriptionSummary: A rare gem has surfaced in the form of a 2009 Bentley Azure, boasting an astonishingly low 1,800 miles on its odometer. Currently up for grabs on Bring a Trailer, bidding stands at $57,500 ahead of the six-day auction deadline.

title: Mexico Raises Tariffs on Chinese Cars to 50%, Balancing U.S. Pressure and Industry Protection
description: Mexico is moving to raise tariffs on Chinese-built vehicles to as high as 50%, a significant hike from current rates in the 15–20% range. Officials say the new measures are part of a broad industrial strategy aimed at protecting domestic jobs and manufacturers. But observers note the timing is also ...
titleSummary: Mexico Slaps Higher Tariffs on China-Car Imports, Walking Fine Line Between Trade and Industry Interests
descriptionSummary: Mexico plans to drastically increase tariffs on Chinese-built vehicles, potentially up to 50%, as part of a broader effort to shield domestic industries and preserve jobs. The move aims to support local manufacturers but has raised eyebrows about its strategic motives.

title: Toyota’s Long-Rumored GRMN Corolla Emerges in a Dealer Event
description: Reports of a more extreme Toyota Corolla have circulated for some time. Earlier this year, talk of a GRMN-badged model gained traction, suggesting Toyota's Gazoo Racing division was preparing something beyond the GR Corolla already on sale. descriptionSummary: Rumors have been swirling about an even more potent Toyota Corolla, potentially bearing the badge of Toyota's high-performance Gazoo Racing division, which could indicate a more aggressive and lightweight driving experience.

title: Why You Can Hear EVs Coming But Can't Find Them Fast Enough
description: You’re at a busy crossing. Three electric cars roll in quietly. You hear a polite electronic hum, maybe a soft beep. Your ears say “car nearby,” but your eyes don’t know where to look. That brief pause is the risk. Today’s warning sounds make EVs audible at low speed; they don’t always help you ...
titleSummary: The Silent Invasion: Electric Cars Make Themselves Heard but Hard to Track.
descriptionSummary: At a crowded intersection, electric vehicles glide in with a gentle whir and subtle tone, creating a temporary disconnect between auditory cues and visual awareness - a fleeting moment of uncertainty for drivers.

title: Forget the S-Class: The New Mercedes-Benz VLS Is in a League of Its Own
description: The Mercedes-Benz S-Class has long been the pinnacle of automotive luxury, so influential that Mercedes eventually extended it into a two-door coupe and a sprawling SUV called the GLS. But now, the brand is taking its top-end opulence in an entirely new direction: the VLS. Revealed as the ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes-Benz's storied S-Class has redefined luxury, spawning variants like the sleek coupe and spacious GLS SUV. Now, the brand is pushing the boundaries of opulence with the revolutionary VLS, a bold new take on automotive refinement.

title: Audi's RS6 e-tron Dream Dies, But the V8 Wagon Lives On
description: Audi has quietly walked back its plans to build the RS6 e-tron, the all-electric performance wagon once hyped as the shining EV centerpiece of the RS lineup. According to insiders, demand for ultra-high-performance electric wagons never really caught fire, and with the broader slowdown in premium ...
titleSummary: Audi Axes Electric Performance Wagon, Puts Faith in V8-Powered Heritage Model
descriptionSummary: Audi has quietly shelved plans for the RS6 e-tron, a high-performance electric wagon that was once touted as a flagship EV model for the brand. It appears the market didn't quite align with the company's initial enthusiasm.

title: 83-Mile Range, $18K Price: Honda's Funky New EV Could Become a Kei Car Favorite
description: Honda’s electrification efforts in the United States have been slow, and some parts of the plan have required help from other automakers, including General Motors. That said, the company offers EVs in other countries that we don’t see, and the latest is the new N-One E, a funky electric kei car ...
titleSummary: "Tiny but Mighty: Honda's Affordable Electric Kei Car Stretches Fuel-Free Horizons"
descriptionSummary: Honda's American electrification strategy has been sluggish, with some initiatives needing outside assistance. However, the brand excels globally, as evidenced by the recently unveiled N-One E – an unconventional, electric mini-car that showcases its innovative spirit overseas.

title: Lucid Now Planning 3 Midsize Models – But Needs Millions in New Capital to Bring Them to Market
description: Lucid Motors doubled its product line-up this year with the launch of the Gravity SUV. descriptionSummary: Lucid Motors expanded its lineup significantly in 2022 with the introduction of the Gravity SUV, but the company's growth has been hampered by manufacturing hold-ups and delivery delays, straining its finances and testing its resources.

title: Will the Volkswagen ID.4 become the ID.Tiguan?
description: The ID.4 crossover remains the only truly mass-market Volkswagen EV sold in the United States. The ID.Buzz may have retro charm, but it's too expensive and too niche to be a volume seller, and VW hasn't brought any other EVs here. So mass appeal is vital to the ID.4's success, and an upcoming name ...
titleSummary: "Volkswagen's Electric Crossover: Tiguan Meets ID.4 in a Game-Changing Mashup"
descriptionSummary: The ID.4 crossover holds its ground as Volkswagen's sole mass-market electric vehicle in the US market. With no other electric options from the brand available, this model must strike a chord with a broad audience.

title: Honda and Acura Sales Stumble In August, Prologue Shines Bright
description: Both new and used vehicle prices have risen rather quickly over the past four years, and they’re showing no signs of stopping. While Honda and Acura’s sales weren’t anything to write home about in August, their year-to-date (YTD) numbers prove that the Japanese automaker is still bringing plenty of ...

descriptionSummary: Vehicle prices have escalated sharply over the past four years, with no slowdown in sight. Despite sluggish sales for Honda and Acura in August, their year-to-date figures indicate a strong performance from the Japanese brand so far.

title: Automotive Journalists Save Puppies! What is Operation Frodo?
description: Operation Frodo is more than a road trip; it’s part of a growing effort to rescue dogs from uncertain futures and deliver them to loving homes thousands of miles away. Along the journey, volunteers get the added joy of connecting with (and cuddling with) the pups while helping save lives. For the ...
titleSummary: "Auto Writers Join Forces to Rescue 10 Distressed Pups in Daring 'Operation Frodo' Mission"
descriptionSummary: A thousand-mile odyssey, Operation Frodo brings hope to desperate dogs by transporting them to forever homes across vast distances, offering a second chance at love and companionship along the way.

title: Stellantis Cans Fully-Electric Ram 1500 Due To Slow Demand
description: In a new statement, Stellantis, the parent company of storied American car brands including Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep, and Ram Trucks, says that it will indefinitely cease development and plans to introduce an all-electric Ram 1500 pickup truck to market. The automaker cites that the decision was made ...
titleSummary: "Ram 1500 EV Axed Amid Lackluster Sales"
descriptionSummary: Stellantis, the parent company behind iconic US brands like Chrysler, Dodge, Jeep, and Ram Trucks, has abruptly ended work on a proposed all-electric Ram 1500 model, opting against its market introduction indefinitely due to unannounced reasons.

title: Toyota, Lexus, And Subaru Are All Wrapped Up In A 100,000 EV Recall
description: Toyota, Lexus, and Subaru have issued a recall covering nearly 100,000 EVs the trio of OEMs have developed together: the Toyota bZ, the Subaru Solterra, and the Lexus RZ. The issue stems from something relatively minor, thankfully, but it has resulted in a stop-sale order while the Japanese ...
titleSummary: "Three Japanese Automakers Face Massive Electric Vehicle Safety Crisis"
descriptionSummary: A joint recall affects over 90,000 electric vehicles produced by Toyota, Lexus, and Subaru, including the Toyota bZ4X, Solterra, and RZ models. A minor issue has prompted a halt on new sales until the problem can be addressed.

title: America Never Gets The Cool Stuff: Toyota Land Cruiser GR Sport Rally Raid Debuts
description: Overseas in Japan, Toyota owns a subsidiary called Toyota Auto Body. As the name suggests, the subsidiary does some work upfitting new Toyota models like the Land Cruiser. descriptionSummary: In Japan, Toyota's subsidiary Toyota Auto Body crafts bespoke upgrades for select Toyota vehicles, such as the rugged Land Cruiser. Their latest collaboration results in a limited-edition GR Sport variant, tailored to thrill local off-road enthusiasts.

title: Ferrari’s Tribute to America After 9/11 Remains One of F1’s Most Powerful Gestures
description: September 11, 2001 shocked the world far beyond America’s borders. Just five days later, at the Italian Grand Prix in Monza, Ferrari used its Formula 1 cars to deliver a silent yet powerful gesture of solidarity. Michael Schumacher and Rubens Barrichello raced in all-red cars stripped of sponsor ...
titleSummary: Ferrari's Emotional Post-9/11 Tribute Still Resonates in Formula One Circles
descriptionSummary: On September 11, 2001, global shockwaves extended far beyond America's shores. Five days later, at the Italian Grand Prix, Ferrari used its Formula 1 cars as a poignant tribute to solidarity, racing in all-red vehicles devoid of sponsorship decals.

title: BMW Design Boss Defends Giant Grilles: “China Wants Them”
description: Adrian van Hooydonk, BMW's head of design since 2009, has weathered years of criticism over the brand's increasingly controversial grille designs. From the polarizing X7 to the massive 7 Series kidney grilles, BMW design has sparked fierce online debates. The first Neue Klasse model, the 2026 BMW ...

descriptionSummary: BMW Design Chief Adrian van Hooydonk faces ongoing backlash for bold new grille styles, which have ignited heated debates over the brand's aesthetic direction since his tenure began in 2009, with models like the X7 and 7 Series at center stage. The 2026 BMW Neue Klasse model is a pivotal test case.

title: Nissan Faces a Bumpy Road to Recovery
description: Nissan’s new CEO has initiated aggressive reforms as he seeks to right the ship, but the automaker faces a tough road ahead as sales remain slow and global competition heats up. CEO Ivan Espinosa’s plans could cost Nissan billions, and the company’s success is anything but guaranteed. A Nissan ...

descriptionSummary: Nissan's new leadership has embarked on a bold turnaround strategy to revitalize the company, but its progress will be put to the test as it navigates sluggish sales and intensifying global competition amidst significant investment risks.

title: 2005 Porsche Carrera GT for Sale With 1,800 Miles
description: Few cars capture the essence of a pure driver’s machine like the Porsche Carrera GT. Built between 2003 and 2007 in a run of just 1,270 units, it combined a motorsport-derived 5.7-liter V10 with a carbon-fiber chassis and a six-speed manual. With 605 horsepower, a 0-60 mph sprint of 3.5 seconds, ...
titleSummary: Rare 2005 Porsche Speedster Up for Grabs at Ultra-Low Mileage.
descriptionSummary: The Porsche Carrera GT embodies the ultimate driving experience. This rare breed of supercar, limited to just over 1,000 units between 2003 and 2007, married a potent V10 engine with an ultralight carbon-fiber frame, delivering breathtaking performance and agility.

title: Ford Focus Could Return in 2027—As an SUV
description: The Ford Focus was one of the Blue Oval's few compact-car successes in the United States, giving U.S. enthusiasts a taste of the crisper handling and styling of the automaker's European products. But Ford's shift in focus (no pun intended) away from cars meant the nameplate was withdrawn from this ...
titleSummary: Ford's Revived Focus Takes Shape: A 2027 Debut as a Crossover Model Anticipated
descriptionSummary: The Ford Focus enjoyed brief but notable success in the US market, bringing a taste of its European heritage - agile handling and stylish design - to American enthusiasts before being phased out as Ford refocused on other priorities.

title: Mercedes' Screen-Obsessed Design Chief Mocks Audi's 'Tiny' Display
description: Gordon Wagener, Mercedes' chief design officer since 2016, isn't known for pulling punches when it comes to automotive design philosophy. The architect behind the brand's controversial Hyperscreen technology, first introduced in the 2021 EQS sedan as a massive 56-inch curved display stretching ...

descriptionSummary: Mercedes' top designer, Gordon Wagener, is infamous for his blunt views on automotive aesthetics. As creator of the divisive Hyperscreen, he brought cutting-edge tech to the masses with the 2021 EQS sedan's groundbreaking 56-inch infotainment system.

title: Why Stellantis Is Backing Off Its 2030 All-Electric Plan
description: The world’s fifth-largest automaker has decided that an all-electric future is not going to happen on the timeline it once promised. Stellantis confirmed that it will no longer pursue its pledge to sell only EVs in Europe by 2030, calling the target unrealistic in today’s market. The move reflects ...

descriptionSummary: Stellantis, one of the world's leading automakers, has scaled back its ambitious electric vehicle strategy, abandoning its goal to exclusively offer EVs in Europe by 2030 due to what it deems an overly optimistic timeline.

title: That High-Mile Third-Gen 4Runner May Run Forever, But There's A New Way To Make That Happen

LC Engineering out of Arizona is offering a fully rebuilt and refurbished "Stage 1" ...

descriptionSummary: Arizona-based LC Engineering offers a premium preventative maintenance solution for Toyota's rugged 5VZ-FE six-cylinder engine, providing a fully rebuilt and refurbished "Stage 1" kit to help extend its lifespan.

title: Nissan Says It Could Fix Traffic By Making Everyone Go The Same Speed
description: Nissan (rightly) points out that the average American spends way too much time in traffic. The company cites a CNBC story that estimates most Americans spend about a week every year in traffic, cumulatively. In light of that, Nissan has some up with a pretty clever way to try and reduce congestion. ...
titleSummary: "Proposal Aims to Simplify City Streets with Uniform, Reduced Speed Limits"
descriptionSummary: Americans waste a significant chunk of their lives stuck in traffic, with many spending nearly a full workweek per year idling away on the road. To combat this, Nissan is pushing an innovative solution to ease congestion.

title: This Crazy Low-Mile Buick Grand National Still Has The Window Sticker Attached To It
description: This '87 Buick Grand National is about as low-mileage a Buick as you'll find. Currently for sale over on Bring a Trailer, the Grand National has just 77 miles on it. descriptionSummary: This pristine '87 Buick Grand National boasts an astonishingly low 77 miles on the odometer and retains its original window sticker intact. Found on Bring a Trailer, it's a time capsule of a car that's never been driven far from home.

title: Toyota to Build EV SUVs at Kentucky Plant Amid Tariff Pressures
description: Toyota is shifting gears in the U.S. by moving future EV SUV production to its Georgetown, Kentucky facility. The announcement underscores both Toyota’s cautious but deliberate approach to electrification and its response to mounting tariff pressures on imported vehicles. The Georgetown plant, ...
titleSummary: Toyota Invests in Electric Vehicles, Shifting Kentucky Production Amid Trade Uncertainty
descriptionSummary: Toyota is revamping its US strategy with plans to manufacture future electric SUVs at its Georgetown, Kentucky factory. This move reflects the company's measured approach to EV adoption and its efforts to mitigate rising import tariffs.

title: Max Verstappen’s Porsche GT2 Is Hitting the Auction Block
description: If there is one thing that makes the Porsche 911 truly unique, it is the fact that the automaker offers it in a wide range of models and trims for its customers. On one end of the scale, some 911s like the 911 Carrera, GTS, or even the Turbo, can be driven daily and enjoyed for a spirited drive on ...
titleSummary: "Verstappen's Rare Porsche GT2 Hits the Market to Astonish Enthusiasts Everywhere"
descriptionSummary: The Porsche 911's versatility is rooted in its extensive lineup, which caters to diverse driving preferences. Models range from everyday-friendly options to high-performance variants, each offering an exhilarating driving experience tailored to individual tastes.

title: Nissan CEO Hunts for Bold Solutions to Revive Aging Lineup
description: In a new interview with Bloomberg, Nissan CEO Ivan Espinosa stated that the automaker's aging lineup is the next order of business on his agenda to turn around the flailing brand, as it faces the eyes of bad fortune. The new chief executive told the financial publication at Nissan's Yokohama ...
titleSummary: "Nissan's New Leader Seeks Radical Makeover to Ignite Fading Sales"
descriptionSummary: Nissan's CEO, Ivan Espinosa, has identified a key area for improvement: refreshing the company's outdated lineup. In an interview with Bloomberg, he highlighted this as a crucial step in reversing the brand's declining fortunes and putting it back on track.

title: The IIHS Is Making It Tougher to Get a Top Safety Pick+ Award
description: For decades, the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety (IIHS) has been a rigorous body focused on upholding automotive safety, as its comprehensive crash tests and ratings pushed automakers to build stronger and safer vehicles with better structures, airbags, and more sophisticated systems to ...
titleSummary: "IIHS Cracks Down on Safety Standards for Top Honor"
descriptionSummary: The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety has long driven innovation in vehicle safety through its rigorous testing protocols, prompting manufacturers to design more robust and secure cars equipped with advanced features.
